benchmark_details.name: ROUTER BENCH
benchmark_details.overview: ROUTER BENCH is a comprehensive benchmark designed for evaluating multi-LLM routing systems, providing a standard for assessing their performance and cost-efficiency in diverse applications.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a standardized framework for evaluating the performance of multi-LLM routing systems, enabling better comparisons and improvements in routing strategies.

data.source: Constructed through inference with 14 different LLMs and existing datasets.
data.annotation: Generated outputs evaluated against ground truth responses.

methods: Systematic evaluation through various routing algorithms
methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on predicted performance scores and associated costs.
methodology.interpretation: Higher AIQ (Average Improvement in Quality) values indicate better routing performance.
methodology.baseline_results: AIQ values for Zero router and various predictive/cascading routers evaluated.
methodology.validation: Benchmark validated against performance across diverse tasks and models.
